title: Video: 5-year-old girl narrowly avoids coyote attack in her front yard
text:
A young girl in Illinois avoided what could have been a horrific attack when a coyote chased her in her front yard, video shows.

The incident occurred Tuesday in the unincorporated area of Villa Park, Illinois, police said, and local media shared security camera footage of the chase in front of the house.

In the video, the coyote is seen lurking near the driveway as the young girl skips around. As she makes her way across the front lawn, the animal sprints toward her, but slows as it turns around tree.

The young girl runs back toward the driveway as the coyote appears to try to attack but then backs off, the video shows.

The girl, 5, told WLS-TV in Chicago that the animal touched her and almost bit her chest before she got away.

"We heard the scream," her mother, Elizabeth Przybylski, told the TV station. "She came in with this wild story."

Przybylski said she and her husband checked the security camera and confirmed their daughter's tale.

"He really pursued her violently, and I'm so glad she got away," Przybylski told WLS-TV. The station reported that the girl had been in the front yard to see if her Halloween costume had arrived in the mail yet.

Local police said they were in contact with local and state wildlife officials but didn't provide additional details about the incident. USA TODAY has also reached out to the Forest Preserve District of DuPage County and state conservation police for comment.

The Forest Preserve District of DuPage County says on its website that coyotes are largely not a concern in the area and that the county does not have any documented cases of coyotes biting humans. Villa Park is just over 20 miles west of Chicago.

description: The incident occurred Tuesday in the unincorporated area of Villa Park, Illinois, police said, and the girl got away safely.
